image.altText: Tiwi person with traditional paint on face dances with hands up during ceremony

props.synopsis: The agreement with the federal government sees the Tiwi Islands included in Australia's national parks and reserves system.

title.children: Tiwi Islands become 700,000-hectare Indigenous Protected Area

image.altText: Men holding signs reading stop the violence against women march in Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: Up to 300 men — and a similar number of women — have taken part in the annual Ingkintja Men's March Against Domestic Violence under the slogan End the silence! Stop the violence! in Alice Springs, coinciding with the International Human Rights Day.

title.children: Hundreds of men march against domestic violence in solidarity with women

image.altText: A picture of two septic tanks with lids off in a remote community backyard.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal housing advocates are calling for urgent improvements to the way remote public housing is maintained in the Northern Territory, after the coroner found the death of a toddler who fell into a backyard septic tank could have been prevented.

title.children: Calls for government action after toddler's death inside unsafe septic tank

image.altText: Cow walking through door of home

props.synopsis: An NT resident tells of discovering he had unexpected guests in his home, after his dogs were filmed nudging open a door and letting inside a pet bull and horse.

title.children: Pet camera captures bull and horse sneaking into NT politician's home

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: The number of people in custody has surged dramatically in the Northern Territory since the government passed sweeping bail and justice reforms in 2024.

title.children: UN blocked from inspecting crammed NT prisons

image.altText: An aerial view of a fracking exploration site in the Beetaloo Basin.

props.synopsis: The gas-rich Beetaloo Basin in the Northern Territory has been in development for years — now, the NT government says the gas will finally flow from 2026.

title.children: Fracked gas to enter NT energy market by 2026 to 'keep the lights on'

image.altText: A corridor of empty prison cells.

props.synopsis: Senior corrections and health staff will change how they respond to health emergencies inside NT jails, following the coronial inquest into the death of a disabled prisoner.

title.children: Corrections, health staff commit to change after grandfather's death in prison

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: The announcement from NT police follows a months-long ABC investigation into the disappearance of a Yolŋu clan leader who vanished without a trace after being acquitted of murdering a police officer.

title.children: Police restart cold case investigation 90 years after clan leader's disappearance

image.altText: A teen girl sits at a vanity looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: After a year of waiting, Australia's world-leading laws to block kids from accessing social media are officially enacted. But the teens they're meant to impact say not much has actually changed.

title.children: Australia's grand experiment is finally live. Teens say nothing has changed

image.altText: Photo shows a logo for Netflix on a remote control

props.synopsis: Australians' electricity bills have become a nightmare of complexity and high prices. An energy regulator says subscription fees could be an answer.

title.children: Netflix-like power charges on the cards as energy rule-maker flags major reset

image.altText: Police help a man set upon by rioters in Cronulla

props.synopsis: Two decades on from the racially-fuelled brawls at Cronulla, experts warn something similar could happen amid anti-immigration rhetoric.

title.children: Fears of 'another Cronulla riot' 20 years on from violence on streets

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling with blonde hair and wearing a striped shirt, date unknown.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old is remembered for her generous spirit and love of animals. It took a protracted effort to bring her killer back to Australia and before a court, during which time he revealed little emotion.

title.children: Inside the seven-year wait for justice for Toyah Cordingley

image.altText: Several tankers lined up in the sea.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says it is "the largest one ever seized".

title.children: US seizes oil tanker off coast of Venezuela, Trump says

image.altText: Illustration of hands using flint and pyrite to produce sparks.

props.synopsis: Archaeologists have uncovered the earliest-known evidence of deliberately lit campfires at a site in the UK dated to be 400,000 years old.

title.children: Ancient campfire pushes back date early humans first made fires

image.altText: The back of a man's head, looking at a laptop screen with a Facebook ad from GIM Trading on it.

props.synopsis: Tech giant Meta ran advertisements used to lure Australian investors into a fraudulent bond scheme that allegedly defrauded tens of millions of dollars from them.

title.children: 'I know it's been stolen': Businessman loses $300k in alleged bond scam

image.altText: A group of zombies surround a car.

props.synopsis: As more businesses look to do their own advertising, audience complaints for social media ads are growing.

title.children: Kia and Dettol ads top complaints list for 2025

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: National Anti-Corruption Commission chief Paul Brereton formally discloses his consulting work for the defence watchdog after the ABC reveals the links.

title.children: NACC chief updates official declaration of interests to disclose defence link

image.altText: Fire burns from the top of a gas well at night.

props.synopsis: A long-awaited scheme to force east coast energy giants to set aside gas for Australian use is being finalised in down-to-the-wire negotiations between half a dozen cabinet ministers grappling with concerns it may not lower prices as much as hoped.

title.children: Fears gas reservation plan will not lower prices as hoped

image.altText: Susan Kennedy with a sign outside the front of her Ramsay Street home saying 'fight the freeway'

props.synopsis: After more than 40 years on air, the final credits will roll on the iconic soap Neighbours — again.

title.children: 'Bring it home in a blaze of glory': Neighbours wraps up, again

image.altText: A pile of Australian dollar coins on top of several bank notes

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar edges closer to a 2025 high after the US Federal Reserve cuts interest rates again. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar climbs as US Fed cuts interest rates

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: AUD up 0.6 per cent to above 66 US cents

image.altText: A shoulders-up portrait of politician Tanya Plibersek

props.synopsis: Regis Resources argues the federal environment department was "uncritical" in accepting evidence about a First Nations Dreaming story that led to its proposed gold project being halted.

title.children: Gold company bids to quash Aboriginal protection order over billion-dollar mine

image.altText: Author Sophie Kinsella poses

props.synopsis: Kinsella, who also published under her real name, Madeleine Wickham, announced in April 2024 that she had been diagnosed in late 2022 with glioblastoma, an aggressive form of brain cancer.

title.children: Sophie Kinsella, author of the best-selling Shopaholic novels, dies at 55

image.altText: A wide brown river and farms

props.synopsis: Jindalee Road Wines and its former manager have been penalised $558,000 for illegally tapping into an irrigation pipeline and stealing water.

title.children: Water thieves forced to pay $558,000

image.altText: A Belarusian tennis player pumps her fist in celebration after a point in the US Open final.

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka is adamant her upcoming clash against Nick Kyrgios will not prove to be a gimmick that damages women's tennis.

title.children: Sabalenka declares polarising Kyrgios clash 'a win-win situation'

image.altText: A pair of hand hold two extra-large strawberries.

props.synopsis: Seasonal conditions are leading to big berries this summer, with the fruit on the larger side in some regions because of a wetter spring.

title.children: Supersized strawberries fill supermarket shelves

image.altText: A middle-aged man with dark hair stares intently while sitting in a gilded room.

props.synopsis: In a leaked internal cable, Secretary of State Marco Rubio calls the department's decision to adopt Calibri in 2023 a "wasteful" diversity move.

title.children: US State Department to revert to Times New Roman font over 'wasteful' Calibri

image.altText: Dolphin Sands bushfire emergency,

props.synopsis: Just days into summer, Tasmania is battling bushfires and their presence can be linked back to a rare spike in temperatures above Antarctica back in September.

title.children: Tasmania's December fires could be a sign of what's ahead this summer

image.altText: Stacey Warnecke smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

title.children: Melbourne influencer died from haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears

image.altText: A screenshot from bodycam footage of Luigi Mangione sitting at a McDonald's table, talking to a police officer.

props.synopsis: A to-do list and travel plans shed light on the steps the 27-year-old may have taken — or planned to take — to avoid capture after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killing last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's to-do list, travel plans found during his arrest

image.altText: A person is holding a sperm sample tube

props.synopsis: Between 2006 and 2022, the man's sperm was sold to 67 clinics in 14 countries, whereas 99 children were fathered by the donor in Denmark alone.

title.children: Nearly 200 children conceived from sperm donor with increased cancer risk

image.altText: caravans in a row

props.synopsis: Zone RV plunged into administration last week, leaving customers, suppliers, employees and taxpayers in a $40 million hole.

title.children: Collapsed caravan manufacturer's staggering debt revealed

image.altText: Dozens of bikes, tractors and makeshift rickshaws form a long line on a road with people and goods inside them

props.synopsis: Thailand has rejected Donald Trump's plan to call both sides to achieve peace, with half a million people forced to flee the fighting along the border.

title.children: Trump's plan to call Thailand and Cambodia to achieve peace rejected

image.altText: Metallic letters spelling Mildura Law Courts on the facade of a light-coloured building.

props.synopsis: Mildura man Jordan Stewart Blair has been found guilty of sexually assaulting a woman less than a day after he viciously bashed her in May, 2024.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping woman 16 hours after brutally beating her

image.altText: Card Catalogue

props.synopsis: The NLA has more than 10 million items, but they are all in storage. Now a new exhibition reveals a selection of its hidden treasures.

title.children: It's one of the country's biggest libraries, so where are all the books?
